intro: Porterandia sikkimensis, commonly known as the Sikkim porterandia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its evergreen shrub form, with small, leathery leaves and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
